unalcol.types.collection.bitarray

Class BitArray

  • java.lang.Object
    • unalcol.types.collection.bitarray.BitArray
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Cloneable

    public class BitArray
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Cloneable

    Title: BitArray

    Description: Stores the positions with a value different of the default value, the values are bits

    Copyright: Copyright (c) 2006

    Company: Kunsamu

    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Jonatan Gomez

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static boolean useGrayCode
      If the BitArray is using Gray code for representing the integer numbers

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      BitArray(BitArray source)
      Constructor: Creates a clone of the bit array given as argument
      BitArray(boolean[] source)
      Constructor: Creates a bit array using the boolean values given in the array
      BitArray(int n, boolean randomly)
      Constructor: Creates a bit array of n bits, in a random way or with all bit in false according to the randomly argument
      BitArray(java.lang.String source)
      Constructor: Creates a bit array using the boolean values given in the string

      • BitArray

        public BitArray(int n,
                boolean randomly)
        Constructor: Creates a bit array of n bits, in a random way or with all bit in false according to the randomly argument
        Parameters:
        n - The size of the bit array
        randomly - If the array will be initialized randomly or not

    • Method Detail

      • random

        public static BitArray random(int limit)
        Utilizada para retornar un BitArray
        Parameters:
        limit - Utilizado para asignarle el tamano al BitArray con el numero de bit requeridos para represnetar su valor
        Returns:
        BitArray de tamano igual al numero de bit para representar limit y contiene 0 y 1 aleatorios

      • get

        Returns the boolean value of a specific position

        The boolean value of a specific position

      • subBitArray

        public BitArray subBitArray(int start)
        Returns a sub bit array of the bit array starting from the position start until the end of the bit array.

        A = 1000111001

        A.subBitArray( 4 ) = 111001

        A.subArray( 0 ) = 1000111001

        A.subArray( 10 ) = empty bit array

        Parameters:
        start - The start position
        Returns:
        A sub bit array of the bit array starting from the position start until the end of the bit array.

      • subBitArray

        public BitArray subBitArray(int start,
                            int end)
        Returns the sub bit array of the bit array starting at the position start and the previous to the position end-1. If the end position is greater than the last position of the array then the function will return only the last bits.

        A = 1000111001

        A.subBitArray( 4, 7 ) = 111

        A.subArray( 0, 4 ) = 1000

        A.subArray( 7, 11 ) = 001

        Parameters:
        start - The start position of the substring
        end - The end position + 1 of the subarray
        Returns:
        The sub bit array of the bit array starting at the position start and the previous to the position end-1.

      • leftShift

        public void leftShift(int k)
        Shifts the bit array to the left in k bits. The remaining bits will be set to zero.

        A = 1010011011

        A.left_shift( 3 ) = 0011011000

        Parameters:
        k - The number of bits to be shifted

      • rightShift

        public void rightShift(int k)
        Shifts the bit array to the right in k bits. The remaining bits will be set to zero

        A = 1010011011

        A.right_shift( 3 ) = 0001010011

        Parameters:
        k - The number of bits to be shifted

      • add

        public void add(BitArray source)
        Add the given bit array to the end of the bit array.

        A = 1001

        B = 11001

        A.add( B ) = 100111001

        Parameters:
        source - The bit array to be added to the end

      • rightSetToOne

        public void rightSetToOne(int start)

        A = 1000110011

        A.rightSetToOne( 6 ) = 1000111111

        Parameters:
        start - The start position to be set to one

        A = 1000111011

      • and

        public void and(BitArray arg2)
        Performs the and operator between the bit array and the given bit array.

        A = 10011001011

        B = 0101010101

        A.and( B ) = 00010001011

        B.and( A ) = 0001000101

        Parameters:
        arg2 - The array used to perform the and operator

      • or

        public void or(BitArray arg2)
        Performs the or operator between the bit array and the given bit array.

        A = 10011001011

        B = 0101010101

        A.or( B ) = 11011101011

        B.or( A ) = 1101110101

        Parameters:
        arg2 - The array used to perform the or operator

      • xor

        public void xor(BitArray arg2)
        Performs the xor operator between the bit array and the given bit array.

        A = 10011001011

        B = 0101010101

        A.xor( B ) = 11001100001

        B.xor( A ) = 1100110000

        Parameters:
        arg2 - The array used to perform the xor operator

      • not

        public void not()
        Flips all the bits in the bit array

        A = 10001001

        A.not() = 01110110

      • not

        public void not(int bit)
        Flips the bit given

        A = 10011011

        A.not( 3 ) = 10001011

        A.not( 5 ) = 10011111

        Parameters:
        bit - apply not
